titleInfo.title: PROVIDING FOR CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 1039, PROBATION OFFICER PROTECTION ACT OF 2017

extension.searchTitle: PROVIDING FOR CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 1039, PROBATION OFFICER PROTECTION ACT OF 2017; Congressional Record Vol. 163, No. 86

congVote.result: So the previous question was ordered.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory1: Probation Officer Protection Act of 2017_Rule for Consideration
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to H. Res. 324, providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 1039) to amend section 3606 of title 18, United States Code, to grant probation officers authority to arrest hostile third parties who obstruct or impede a probation officer in the performance of official duties, by a recorded vote of 230 ayes to 184 noes, Roll No. 264, after the previous question was ordered by a yea-and-nay vote of 226 yeas to 188 nays, Roll No. 263.

congVote.result: So the resolution was agreed to.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory1: Probation Officer Protection Act of 2017_Rule for Consideration
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to H. Res. 324, providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 1039) to amend section 3606 of title 18, United States Code, to grant probation officers authority to arrest hostile third parties who obstruct or impede a probation officer in the performance of official duties, by a recorded vote of 230 ayes to 184 noes, Roll No. 264, after the previous question was ordered by a yea-and-nay vote of 226 yeas to 188 nays, Roll No. 263.

congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House passed H.R. 115, to amend title 18, United States Code, to provide additional aggravating factors for the imposition of the death penalty based on the status of the victim, by a yea-and-nay vote of 271 yeas to 143 nays, Roll No. 265.

extension.searchTitle: HONORING HOMETOWN HEROES ACT; Congressional Record Vol. 163, No. 86

congVote.result: So (two-thirds being in the affirmative) the rules were suspended and the bill was passed.
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to suspend the rules and pass the following measures. Consideration began Tuesday, May 16th.<P/>H.R. 1892, to amend title 4, United States Code, to provide for the flying of the flag at half-staff in the event of the death of a first responder in the line of duty, by a \2/3\ yea-and-nay vote of 411 yeas to 1 nay, Roll No. 266.

congVote.result: The PRESIDING OFFICER. Under the previous order, the motion to reconsider is considered made and laid upon the table and the President will be immediately notified of the Senate's action.

extension.searchTitle: CLOTURE MOTION; Congressional Record Vol. 163, No. 86

congVote.dailyDigestSummary: : Senate resumed consideration of the nomination of Terry Branstad, of Iowa, to be Ambassador to the People's Republic of China.<P/>During consideration of this nomination today, Senate also took the following action:<P/>By 86 yeas to 12 nays (Vote No. 132), Senate agreed to the motion to close further debate on the nomination.
